newsitem.title: INDIA: Foreign firms sign mining agreements in India.
newsitem.headline: Foreign firms sign mining agreements in India.

text.p: Leading foreign companies are registering to conduct mining surveys in the western Indian state of Rajasthan, the Press Trust of India (PTI) said on Monday.

PTI quoted a state spokesman as saying Australia's The Broken Hill Pty Co (BHP) and CRA Exploration Pty Ltd have signed agreements with India's Hindustan Zinc Limited and Associated Cement Companies, respectively, to explore for base metals in the state.
It said the British firm Matmin Finance and Holding had applied for prospecting.
It said proposals from the three foreign companies had been sent to New Delhi where the federal government would issue licences for aerial surveys.
Rajasthan is also wooing foreign firms for oil exploration, PTI said, adding that Britain's Shell International had signed a memorandum of understanding on exploration with the government.
